item.title: Problem Find Common Characters
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1002 Question Given a string array words, return an array of all characters that show up in all strings within the words (including duplicates). You may return the answer in any order. Example 1 Input: words = ["bella","label","roller"] Output: ["e","l","l"] Example 2 Input: words = ["cool","lock","cook"] Output: ["c","o"] Constraints 1 <= words.length <= 100 1 <= words[i].length <= 100 words[i] consists of lowercase English letters. Solution class Solution { public: vector<string> commonChars(vector<string>& words) { vector<int>baselineCount(26,0); string temp; for(int i =0;i<words[0].

item.title: Problem Reverse String
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 344 Question Write a function that reverses a string. The input string is given as an array of characters s. You must do this by modifying the input array in-place with O(1) extra memory. Example 1 Input: s = ["h","e","l","l","o"] Output: ["o","l","l","e","h"] Example 2 Input: s = ["H","a","n","n","a","h"] Output: ["h","a","n","n","a","H"] Constraints 1 <= s.length <= 10^5 s[i] is a printable ascii character. Solution class Solution { public: void reverseString(vector<char>& s) { int start = 0, end = s.

item.title: Problem Score of a String
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 3110 Question You are given a string s. The score of a string is defined as the sum of the absolute difference between the ASCII values of adjacent characters. Return the score of s. Example 1 Input: s = "hello" Output: 13 Explanation: The ASCII values of the characters in s are: 'h' = 104, 'e' = 101, 'l' = 108, 'o' = 111. So, the score of s would be |104 - 101| + |101 - 108| + |108 - 108| + |108 - 111| = 3 + 7 + 0 + 3 = 13.

item.title: Problem Reverse Prefix of Word
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2000 Question Given a 0-indexed string word and a character ch, reverse the segment of word that starts at index 0 and ends at the index of the first occurrence of ch (inclusive). If the character ch does not exist in word, do nothing. For example, if word = "abcdefd" and ch = "d", then you should reverse the segment that starts at 0 and ends at 3 (inclusive).
